A horse is any of several species of large, hoofed mammals of the family Equidae. The best-known species is the Equus caballus, or domestic horse. Horses are found worldwide and have been domesticated for thousands of years.
A horse breed is a selectively bred population of horses with a distinctive set of characteristics.

A horse is a hoofed mammal, a subspecies of the family Equidae.
A horse is a hoofed mammal, one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is a single-hooved (ungulate) domesticated animal, a subspecies of the wild horse of Eurasia.
There are many breeds of horses. The most common are the Arabian, the Appaloosa, the Clydesdale, the Friesian, the Morgan, and the Thoroughbred.

The Arabian or Arab horse (Arabic: الحصان العربي‎ [ħisˤaːn ʕarabiː], DMG ḥiṣān ʿarabī) is a breed of horse that originated on the Arabian Peninsula.

The Arabian or Arab horse is a breed of horse that originated on the Arabian Peninsula. With a distinctive head shape and high tail carriage, the Arabian is one of the most easily recognizable horse breeds in the world.

The American Saddlebred is a horse breed from the United States. This breed was referred to as the Horse America Made.

The American Quarter Horse is the most popular breed in the United States today, and the American Quarter Horse Association is the largest breed registry in the world, with almost 3 million living American Quarter Horses registered in 2014.
The Morgan horse is one of the earliest horse breeds developed in the United States.

A draft horse (US), draught horse (UK, Ireland and Commonwealth) or dray horse (from the Old English dragan meaning "to draw or haul"; compare Dutch dragen and German tragen meaning "to carry" or "to draw") is a large horse bred to be a working animal doing hard tasks such as plowing and other farm labor.

The Belgian horse or Belgian draft horse, also known as Belgian Heavy Horse, Brabant, or Brabant horse, is a draft horse breed from the Brabant region of modern Belgium, where it is called the Cheval de trait belge or Brabant
There are more than 300 breeds of horses and ponies in the world today.
The Shire is a breed of draught horse. It is usually black, bay, or grey. It is a tall breed, and Shires have at various times held world records both for the largest horse and for the tallest horse.
The Clydesdale is a breed of draught horse derived from the farm horses of Clydesdale, Scotland, and named after that region.
The Friesian is a horse breed originating in Friesland, in the Netherlands.
The American Quarter Horse is an American breed of horse that excels at sprinting short distances.
A breed is a group of animals that are similar and can have babies together.
The Percheron is a breed of draft horse that originated in the Huisne river valley in western France, part of the former Perche province from which the breed takes its name.
The harness is used to attach the horse to a vehicle such as a carriage, cart or sleigh or to hitch animals to other loads such as a plough or canal boat.

The Shetland pony is a breed of pony originating in the Shetland Isles. Shetland ponies have heavy coats, short legs and are considered quite intelligent. They are a very strong breed of pony, used for riding, driving, and pack purposes.
